Darlag (Tarlag). Destination: Baima, Beiyu, Aba.

No big deal. Walk out of this small town so that the van drivers will not bother you. You can hitch literally everywhere. It shouldn't take more than 10 minutes to get a ride towards Baima. Loads of cars going to Aba. If going to Aba, make sure that the Aba County is not currently closed for foreigners due to the recent self-immolations performed by Tibetans.

A small truckers' town of HuaShiXia.

Direction: Tarlag, Baima.

Plenty of space on the roadside available. Just like anywhere in the Tibetan areas in Qinghai - extremely easy to catch a ride. Just make it clear at the beginning that you 'haven't got money, is it ok?'

Toll gate. Destination: Taiyuan, Pingyao, Xi'an.

From Datong railway station:

1. Take the double-decker bus no 15. Get off at the final stop.

You'll end up in a not particularly pleasant slum area. However, delicious street food is abundant here and the locals are exceptionally friendly and curious. Don't be worried to stroll around!

Upon getting off the bus, proceed towards the street market. You should see the big factory in front of you, far in the distant background.

Take a bit narrow,
Getting into Xiahe from here is no problem! Just keep a smart distance to the toll gate, and flag down those tourists. Best in summer.
April 2012. Two backapckers got a single ride to kunming in 20 minutes using a sign. Police officers saw our actions and let us be.
The toll gate is located close to the bus station and is a good spot going to Kunming
Worked really well for me in the direction of Hong Kong.

Take the 301 bus to the airport from Nanning city centre. You\\'ll need to walk about 1.5 km back along the Expy and then turn left. You should have no trouble getting a long distance ride from here, sometimes all the way to the border
Same truck took us further down to нарын, but an excellent place to get other rides, and the Kyrgyz border itself is not too far away if you walk.

Border guards will not allow you to cross by truck, they will either put you in a military truck or you will be put on a bus heading in the same direction.  Crossing the border at the arc, is done by walking, and at the Kyrgyz side you can get another truck or talk to your previous truck driver to wait for you if possible (what we did).

Only plausible place where you will get a ride is at the police checkpoint near the customs area where they check your passport or 20 km down the road at the next police checkpoint.  Talk to the police officers and explain your situation, truckers are convinced that they are not allowed to take hitchhikers, but that is not the case when the police explains to them there are not going to be any problems down the road.  Take a truck from here (preferably Kyrgyz) and go to the second to last border
Asked a Tajik truckdriver to take us, after I asked him where he was heading to.  Russian language will be a major help.

For going North. There's spot for cars to pull up right nexct to the police station (policeman approved hitching). God a ride from a local Khampa to Dawu in 5 minutes (I had a sign in chinese saying Dawu)

We got dropped on a police checkpoint (our driver was going to Danbe and we to Dawu). 
The Policeman gave us noodles and helped hitched. Since all the cars had to pass the police check they were asking them if they are going to our destination and can take us. We got a ride to Dawu in 30 minutes!

Very good spot for going east of Litang. Plenty of space to pull up, it's next to some kind of Litang small monument so people often come to stop there. We saw a monk hitching from here a moment before us. We got a ride to Bame in 20 minutes (with sign in Chinese saying Yajiang)

Lhasa is boring, and it's hard to hitchhike in Lhasa. I hitchhiked the how 317 road, Lhasa has the worst experience. If you keep going on 318 to 林芝（linzhi）the view is really amazing again. if you are not Chinese, don't take photos alone the way, especially buildings of any sorts, you may get into troubles
there is a very beautiful lake in 当雄 called 纳木措
best journey I ever experienced, the driver asked us to stay at his place. he brought us for a hot spring the next day, he offered raw beef meat
it was harsh weather in winter, all you can do is waving your hand, local people don't know what a thumb means. the police station is where you can ask for stay and food and hot water
was super convenient to hitchhike here, maybe because I was wearing a Tibet style clothe
was by a local resident, a herdsman. Me and my friend stayed at their home for two more days, for Chinese new year

by the barrier-toll. That's highway for 4 directions, we were in two, heading to Xi'an, that's quite far away... If you want to go to Xi'an and nobody drives theren, it might be a good idea to get a lift to Tianshui, which is on the way, as many driver heads there.

Good to start from here, than use highway in way down deep to China. Cheers

Another good spot to hitch towards Panjihua/the eastern route to Chengdu. Just stand on the entrance to the ramp and hold the sign that says Panjihua or something like this (must be in Chinese!) and you should easily catch a lift out of town.

Good spot to hitch towards Mount Bogda, Mongolian border in Takeshiken or northern Xinjiang. Find your bus on http://map.baidu.com/ there are stop nearby.
Ask the drivers if they're going to Fuyun as most traffic will be heading off to the industrial districts just north of Urumqi. In Fuyun get off at the toll booths and you'll get a ride to your destination.
As many drivers in Xinjiang ask you to pay for the ride, use the magical phrase "mien fei" (lit. "avoid fee") before you hop in the car.

It's the main road out of town going south. Little traffic, but some may go far. Be sure to get a ride that's a least a bit far or you'll get stuck in Inner Mongolia where there is little traffic.
Easily accessible spot (from Zhuzilin station), highway heading to Guangzhou. Some drivers will ask for money, ignore them. A free ride will come.

Toll gate - excellent spot for rides south towards Xian. It's a popular hitchhiking spot I guess, so staff and highway police are used to these strange foreigners on the highway ;-). To get here take the metro (Line 14) to Yuanboyuan station (Garden Expo Park - Exit C). From here it's around 1.5 kilometer walk to Dujiakan Roundabout and the ramp-on to the highway, where there are the toll gates. Alternatively take any bus which goes along Yuanbo Ave. to
Dujiakan Roundabout.

Rest Area - good spot to get rides North. Bus 167 goes over the bridge to the "island" where the rest area is situated (catch the bus on Qixia Ave, 200 meter west of Heyan Rd./Qixia Ave. intersection - bus 6 goes to Heyan Rd from Zhujiang Rd.).

Toll Gate - good spot for rides towards Shanghai (waiting time 15 minutes, staff didn't let me stand on the highway side of the gates though). To get here take the metro (Linping line) to Nanyuan station. Walk five minutes South along Yingbin Rd to the toll gates.
